00035 /************************** PRIVATE MACROS *************************/
00036 #define CAN_TRANSMIT                            1
00037 #define CAN_RECEIVE                                     !CAN_TRANSMIT
00038 #define TX_BUFFER_SIZE                          4
00039 #define RX_BUFFER_SIZE                          2

00041 /************************** PRIVATE VARIABLES *************************/
00042 uint8_t menu[]=
00043         "********************************************************************************\n\r"
00044         "Hello NXP Semiconductors \n\r"
00045         "CAN demo \n\r"
00046         "\t - MCU: LPC17xx \n\r"
00047         "\t - Core: ARM CORTEX-M3 \n\r"
00048         "\t - Communicate via: UART0 - 115200 bps \n\r"
00049         "Use 2 CAN peripherals on 2 boards to transfer data \n\r"
00050         "********************************************************************************\n\r";

00053 CAN_MSG_Type TXMsg, RXMsg; // messages for test Bypass mode
00054 CAN_MSG_Type AFTxMsg[TX_BUFFER_SIZE], AFRxMsg[RX_BUFFER_SIZE]; //messages for test Acceptance Filter mode
00055 uint32_t CANRxCount = 0, CANTxCount = 0;
00056 uint32_t CANErrCount = 0;

00068 /*----------------- INTERRUPT SERVICE ROUTINES --------------------------*/
00069 /*********************************************************************/
00074 void CAN_IRQHandler()
00075 {
00076         uint8_t IntStatus;
00077         /* get interrupt status
00078          * Note that: Interrupt register CANICR will be reset after read.
00079          * So function "CAN_IntGetStatus" should be call only one time
00080          */
00081         IntStatus = CAN_IntGetStatus(LPC_CAN1);
00082         //check receive interrupt
00083         if((IntStatus>>0)&0x01)
00084         {
00085                 CAN_ReceiveMsg(LPC_CAN1, &AFRxMsg[CANRxCount]);
00086                 PrintMessage(&AFRxMsg[CANRxCount]);_DBG_("");
00087                 CANRxCount++;
00088         }
00089 }
00090 
00091 /*-------------------------PRIVATE FUNCTIONS----------------------------*/
00092 /*********************************************************************/
00097 void PrintMessage(CAN_MSG_Type* CAN_Msg)
00098 {
00099         uint32_t data;
00100         _DBG("Message ID:     ");
00101         _DBH32(CAN_Msg->id);_DBG_("");
00102         _DBG("Message length: ");
00103         _DBH32(CAN_Msg->len);_DBG_(" BYTES");
00104         _DBG("Message type:   ");
00105         if(CAN_Msg->type==DATA_FRAME)
00106         {
00107                 _DBG_("DATA FRAME ");
00108         }
00109         else
00110                 _DBG_("REMOTE FRAME ");
00111         _DBG("Message format: ");
00112         if(CAN_Msg->format==STD_ID_FORMAT)
00113         {
00114                 _DBG_("STANDARD ID FRAME FORMAT");
00115         }
00116         else
00117                 _DBG_("EXTENDED ID FRAME FORMAT");
00118         _DBG("Message dataA:  ");
00119         data = (CAN_Msg->dataA[0])|(CAN_Msg->dataA[1]<<8)|(CAN_Msg->dataA[2]<<16)|(CAN_Msg->dataA[3]<<24);
00120         _DBH32(data);_DBG_("");
00121         data = (CAN_Msg->dataB[0])|(CAN_Msg->dataB[1]<<8)|(CAN_Msg->dataB[2]<<16)|(CAN_Msg->dataB[3]<<24);
00122         _DBG("Message dataB:  ");
00123         _DBH32(data);_DBG_("");
00124         _DBG_("");
00125 }
00126 
00127 /*********************************************************************/
00134 CAN_ERROR CAN_SetupAFTable(void) {
00135         uint32_t i = 0;
00136         uint8_t result;
00137         /* Set up Explicit Standard Frame Format Identifier Section
00138          * In this simple test, it has 16 entries ID
00139          */
00140         for (i = 0; i < 16; i++) {
00141                 result = CAN_LoadExplicitEntry(LPC_CAN1, i + 1, STD_ID_FORMAT);
00142         }
00143         /* Set up Explicit Extended Frame Format Identifier Section
00144          * In this simple test, it has 16 entries ID
00145          */
00146         for (i = 0; i < 16; i++) {
00147                 result = CAN_LoadExplicitEntry(LPC_CAN1, i << 11, EXT_ID_FORMAT);
00148         }
00149         return result;
00150 }
00151 
00152 /*********************************************************************/
00158 void CAN_InitAFMessage(void) {
00159         /* 1st Message with 11-bit ID which exit in AF Look-up Table */
00160         AFTxMsg[0].id = 0x08;
00161         AFTxMsg[0].len = 0x08;
00162         AFTxMsg[0].type = DATA_FRAME;
00163         AFTxMsg[0].format = STD_ID_FORMAT;
00164         AFTxMsg[0].dataA[0] = AFTxMsg[0].dataA[1] = AFTxMsg[0].dataA[2]= AFTxMsg[0].dataA[3]= 0x78;
00165         AFTxMsg[0].dataB[0] = AFTxMsg[0].dataB[1] = AFTxMsg[0].dataB[2]= AFTxMsg[0].dataB[3]= 0x21;
00166 
00167         /* 2nd Message with 11-bit ID which not exit in AF Look-up Table */
00168         AFTxMsg[1].id = 0xA0;
00169         AFTxMsg[1].len = 0x08;
00170         AFTxMsg[1].type = DATA_FRAME;
00171         AFTxMsg[1].format = STD_ID_FORMAT;
00172         AFTxMsg[1].dataA[0] = AFTxMsg[1].dataA[1] = AFTxMsg[1].dataA[2]= AFTxMsg[1].dataA[3]= 0x23;
00173         AFTxMsg[1].dataB[0] = AFTxMsg[1].dataB[1] = AFTxMsg[1].dataB[2]= AFTxMsg[1].dataB[3]= 0x45;
00174 
00175         /* 3th Message with 29-bit ID which exit in AF Look-up Table */
00176         AFTxMsg[2].id = (0x08 << 11);
00177         AFTxMsg[2].len = 0x08;
00178         AFTxMsg[2].type = DATA_FRAME;
00179         AFTxMsg[2].format = EXT_ID_FORMAT;
00180         AFTxMsg[2].dataA[0] = AFTxMsg[2].dataA[1] = AFTxMsg[2].dataA[2]= AFTxMsg[2].dataA[3]= 0x15;
00181         AFTxMsg[2].dataB[0] = AFTxMsg[2].dataB[1] = AFTxMsg[2].dataB[2]= AFTxMsg[2].dataB[3]= 0x36;
00182 
00183         /* 4th Message with 29-bit ID which not exit in AF Look-up Table */
00184         AFTxMsg[3].id = (0xA0 << 11);
00185         AFTxMsg[3].len = 0x08;
00186         AFTxMsg[3].type = DATA_FRAME;
00187         AFTxMsg[3].format = EXT_ID_FORMAT;
00188         AFTxMsg[3].dataA[0] = AFTxMsg[3].dataA[1] = AFTxMsg[3].dataA[2]= AFTxMsg[3].dataA[3]= 0x78;
00189         AFTxMsg[3].dataB[0] = AFTxMsg[3].dataB[1] = AFTxMsg[3].dataB[2]= AFTxMsg[3].dataB[3]= 0x21;
00190 
00191         AFRxMsg[0].id = AFRxMsg[1].id = 0x00;
00192         AFRxMsg[0].len = AFRxMsg[1].len = 0x00;
00193         AFRxMsg[0].type = AFRxMsg[1].type = 0x00;
00194         AFRxMsg[0].format = AFRxMsg[1].format = 0x00;
00195         AFRxMsg[0].dataA[0] = AFRxMsg[1].dataA[0] = 0x00;
00196         AFRxMsg[0].dataA[1] = AFRxMsg[1].dataA[1] = 0x00;
00197         AFRxMsg[0].dataA[2] = AFRxMsg[1].dataA[2] = 0x00;
00198         AFRxMsg[0].dataA[3] = AFRxMsg[1].dataA[3] = 0x00;
00199         AFRxMsg[0].dataB[0] = AFRxMsg[1].dataB[0] = 0x00;
00200         AFRxMsg[0].dataB[1] = AFRxMsg[1].dataB[1] = 0x00;
00201         AFRxMsg[0].dataB[2] = AFRxMsg[1].dataB[2] = 0x00;
00202         AFRxMsg[0].dataB[3] = AFRxMsg[1].dataB[3] = 0x00;
00203 }
00204 /*********************************************************************/
00209 void print_menu(void)
00210 {
00211         _DBG_(menu);

00214 /*-------------------------MAIN FUNCTION------------------------------*/
00215 /*********************************************************************/
00220 int c_entry(void) { /* Main Program */
00221         uint32_t result,i;
00222         PINSEL_CFG_Type PinCfg;
00223 
00224         /* Initialize debug via UART0
00225          * – 115200bps
00226          * – 8 data bit
00227          * – No parity
00228          * – 1 stop bit
00229          * – No flow control
00230          */
00231         debug_frmwrk_init();
00232         print_menu();
00233 
00234         /* Pin configuration
00235          * CAN1: select P0.0 as RD1. P0.1 as TD1
00236          */
00237         PinCfg.Funcnum = 1;
00238         PinCfg.OpenDrain = 0;
00239         PinCfg.Pinmode = 0;
00240         PinCfg.Pinnum = 0;
00241         PinCfg.Portnum = 0;
00242         PINSEL_ConfigPin(&PinCfg);
00243         PinCfg.Pinnum = 1;
00244         PINSEL_ConfigPin(&PinCfg);
00245 
00246         //Initialize CAN1
00247         CAN_Init(LPC_CAN1, 125000);
00248 #if CAN_RECEIVE
00249         //Enable Interrupt
00250         CAN_IRQCmd(LPC_CAN1, CANINT_RIE, ENABLE);
00251 
00252         //Enable CAN Interrupt
00253         NVIC_EnableIRQ(CAN_IRQn);
00254         CAN_SetAFMode(LPC_CANAF, CAN_Normal);
00255 
00256         /* Test Acceptance Filter with a simple AF Look-up Table. It just has two sections:
00257          *              - Explicit Standard Frame Format Identifier Section
00258          *              - Explicit Extended Frame Format Identifier Section
00259          * We use 4 Message:
00260          *              - 1 Message with 11-bit ID which exit in AF Look-up Table
00261          *      - 1 Message with 11-bit ID which not exit in AF Look-up Table
00262          *      - 1 Message with 29-bit ID which exit in AF Look-up Table
00263          *      - 1 Message with 29-bit ID which not exit in AF Look-up Table
00264          *  to check Acceptance filter operation of CAN
00265          */
00266         _DBG_("Test Acceptance Filter function...");
00267         CAN_SetAFMode(LPC_CANAF, CAN_Normal);
00268         result = CAN_SetupAFTable(); /* setup AF Look-up Table */
00269         if (result != CAN_OK) {
00270                 _DBG_("Setup AF: ERROR...");
00271                 while(1);
00272         }
00273         else _DBG_("Setup AF: SUCCESSFUL...");_DBG_("");
00274         _DBG_("Recieving message...");
00275 #else
00276         CAN_InitAFMessage(); /* initialize Transmit Message */
00277         for (i = 0; i < TX_BUFFER_SIZE; i++)
00278         {
00279                 CAN_SendMsg(LPC_CAN1, &AFTxMsg[i]);
00280                 PrintMessage(&AFTxMsg[i]);_DBG_("");
00281                 for(result=0;result<10000;result++);
00282                 CANTxCount++;
00283         }
00284         _DBG_("Sending finished !!!");
00285 #endif
00286         while (1);
00287 }
00288 
00289 /* With ARM and GHS toolsets, the entry point is main() - this will
00290  allow the linker to generate wrapper code to setup stacks, allocate
00291  heap area, and initialize and copy code and data segments. For GNU
00292  toolsets, the entry point is through __start() in the crt0_gnu.asm
00293  file, and that startup code will setup stacks and data */
00294 int main(void) {
00295         return c_entry();
00296 }

00308          ex: printf("Wrong parameters value: file %s on line %d\r\n", file, line) */
00309 
00310         /* Infinite loop */
00311         while (1)
00312                 ;
00313 }
